intro: Hieracium moense, commonly known as the greater mouse-ear hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Hieracium moense is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
